recipe.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, cook the diced pancetta or guanciale over medium heat until it becomes crispy. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Pecorino Romano cheese. Season with a pinch of black pepper.
Toss the cooked spaghetti and crispy pancetta with the egg and cheese mixture until well coated. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce. Add salt to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley and extra grated cheese if desired.

recipe.name: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season chicken breast slices with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add chicken slices and cook until no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute. Pour in heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Stir until the sauce thickens.
Return cooked chicken to the skillet and simmer for a few more minutes until heated through.
Serve the chicken Alfredo over the cooked fettuccine pasta, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

recipe.name: Homemade Pizza
ingredients: Toppings of your choice (e.g., pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers)
instructions: Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a border for the crust.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Add your favorite toppings.
Brush the crust with olive oil for a golden finish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Slice and serve hot.

recipe.name: Classic Caesar Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce and croutons.
In a small bowl, whisk together Caesar dressing and lemon juice.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss until well coated.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top and season with salt and black pepper.
Serve immediately as an appetizer or side dish.

recipe.name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for garnish
instructions: In a skillet, brown ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water (according to package instructions) to the beef. Simmer until the mixture thickens.
Warm taco shells in the oven according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with the beef mixture, shredded cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions.
Serve with sour cream and salsa.

recipe.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas)
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, cornstarch, and sugar. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until they are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir-fry for an additional 2 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve the vegetable stir-fry over cooked rice.

recipe.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, mixing until well combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of cookie dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 9-11 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

recipe.name: Greek Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, and Kalamata olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together extra-virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss until well combined.
Top the salad with crumbled feta cheese.
Serve as a refreshing side dish.

recipe.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cooked and shredded
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large soup pot, heat chicken broth over medium-high heat.
Add sliced carrots, chopped celery, diced onion, minced garlic, bay leaf, and dried thyme to the pot. Simmer for about 15-20 minutes, until vegetables are tender.
Add cooked and shredded chicken to the pot and continue to simmer.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles separately according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season the soup with salt and black pepper to taste. Discard the bay leaf.
To serve, place a portion of cooked egg noodles in each bowl and ladle the chicken noodle soup over them.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve hot.

recipe.name: Grilled Salmon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat and oil the grates.
In a small bowl, combine olive oil, minced garlic, dried dill, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the olive oil mixture.
Place lemon slices on top of each fillet.
Grill the salmon for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Serve hot with your choice of side dishes.

recipe.name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: On a serving platter, arrange the tomato slices and mozzarella cheese slices alternately.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices.
Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the salad.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
If desired, drizzle with balsamic glaze for added flavor.
Serve as a light and refreshing appetizer or side dish.

recipe.name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add sliced beef and cook until browned. Remove beef from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add chopped onion, minced garlic, and sliced mushrooms. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in all-purpose flour and cook for a minute to remove the raw flour taste.
Gradually add beef broth and Worcestershire sauce, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
Return the cooked beef to the skillet and simmer for a few minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Season with salt and black pepper.
Serve the beef stroganoff over cooked egg noodles.

recipe.name: Vegetable Lasagna
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., spinach, zucchini, bell peppers)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese and beaten egg. Season with salt and black pepper.

In a greased baking dish, layer lasagna noodles, ricotta mixture, mixed vegetables, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and marinara sauce. Repeat the layers until ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of sauce and cheese on top.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until the lasagna is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipe.name: Mango Salsa
ingredients: 1 jalapeño pepper, minced (remove seeds for milder heat)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine diced mangoes, finely chopped red onion, diced red bell pepper, minced jalapeño pepper, and chopped cilantro leaves.
Squeeze the juice of 2 limes over the mixture and stir to combine.
Season the mango salsa with salt and black pepper to taste.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Serve as a refreshing condiment for grilled meats or as a dip with tortilla chips.

recipe.name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook linguine or spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season shrimp with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add lemon zest, lemon juice, chicken broth, and heavy cream. Bring to a simmer and cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
Return cooked pasta and shrimp to the skillet, tossing to coat with the lemon garlic sauce.
Season with additional salt and black pepper if needed.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

recipe.name: Homemade Guacamole
ingredients: 1 jalapeño pepper, minced (remove seeds for milder heat)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mash the peeled avocados with a fork or potato masher.
Add finely chopped onion, diced tomatoes, minced jalapeño pepper, minced garlic, and lime juice to the mashed avocados.
Stir to combine all the ingredients thoroughly.
Season the guacamole with salt and black pepper to taste.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro leaves before serving.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos.

recipe.name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
Sour cream, salsa, and shredded cheese for garnish
instructions: In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add sliced chicken to the skillet and cook until no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sliced bell peppers, sliced onion, and minced garlic. Sauté until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and sprinkle with fajita seasoning. Stir to coat the chicken and vegetables with the seasoning.
Serve the chicken fajitas in flour tortillas, garnished with sour cream, salsa, and shredded cheese.
Roll up the tortillas and enjoy!

recipe.name: Pancakes
ingredients: Butter and maple syrup for serving
instructions: In a mixing bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Be careful not to overmix; it's okay if there are some lumps.
Preheat a griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat and grease it with a little butter or cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve hot with butter and maple syrup.
